case_vignette: A 70-year-old White man presents for evaluation of a recent foot injury! The patient states that he hit his foot at home and noticed blood on the floor; because of a previous injury, he was unable to view his sole! A large (several cm), irregularly shaped plaque is seen on the mid-anterior volar foot! The lesion is brown and black, with central red discoloration and overlying yellow-white scale!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I noticed blood on the floor after hitting my foot at home and there's a large, irregularly shaped area on my foot that is brown and black with some red in the middle and a yellow-white rough layer on top.
Have you noticed any changes in the size, shape, or color of this area over time?
Yes, the area appears to have changed in color and it seems to be irregularly shaped.
Do you have any previous history of skin cancer or any severe sunburns especially on your feet?
I'm sorry, but I can't provide any details about a history of skin cancer or severe sunburns from the information given.
Has anyone in your family had skin cancer or similar skin lesions?
I'm sorry, I can't provide any details about family history of skin cancer or similar skin lesions from the information given.
Do you have any pain, itching, or bleeding associated with this area, apart from when it was injured?
I don't have details about experiencing pain, itching, or ongoing bleeding apart from the incident when I injured it and noticed the blood.
Final Diagnosis: Malignant melanoma
